publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1197# Brian Adam: 1911 and 1921 Census Records-That the Parliament recognises that the Census records for 1841 to 1891 were released after less than 82 years of closure and commends this practice; regrets the introduction of a 100-year rule in 1974, and considers that the Scottish Executive should review the position for the 1911 and 1921 Census records to allow greater access for those who wish to pursue their family history.
S2M-1197# 1911 and 1921 Census Records (lodged on 26 April 2004) Fergus Ewing*, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-1197# 1911 and 1921 Census Records (lodged on 26 April 2004) John Swinburne*

S2M-1197# Brian Adam: 1911 and 1921 Census Records-That the Parliament recognises that the Census records for 1841 to 1891 were released after less than 82 years of closure and commends this practice; regrets the introduction of a 100-year rule in 1974, and considers that the Scottish Executive should review the position for the 1911 and 1921 Census records to allow greater access for those who wish to pursue their family history. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Fiona Hyslop, John Swinburne
S2M-1197# 1911 and 1921 Census Records (lodged on 26 April 2004) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Rob Gibson*, Murray Tosh*, Mike Pringle*, Ms Sandra White*, Linda Fabiani*, Shiona Baird*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-1197# 1911 and 1921 Census Records (lodged on 26 April 2004) Stewart Stevenson*
S2M-1197# 1911 and 1921 Census Records (lodged on 26 April 2004) Carolyn Leckie*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1197# 1911 and 1921 Census Records (lodged on 26 April 2004) Michael Matheson*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-1197# 1911 and 1921 Census Records (lodged on 26 April 2004) Alasdair Morgan*
S2M-1197# 1911 and 1921 Census Records (lodged on 26 April 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
